page.title: 10TRANSPORT AROUND PENSBY
page.content: In our survey, 54% of people interviewed lived in Heswall itself, 12% came from Pensby, 11% from Gayton, 8% from Irby and 5% from Neston, Barnston and Birkenhead. Therefore the majority of the shoppers lived within 3Km of the village. Most people we spoke to came to Heswall twice a week. They came for shopping although one or two worked here. We also asked them how they had travelled into the village on that (sunny) day in June. 70% came by car, 13% came on the bus and 17% walked. The high percentage of car use seems to relate to the class structure in the area, with most families owning one car, and many having two. This is reinforced if we look at how the children get to their Cub or Brownie meeting. A massive 68.6% travel by car but only 31.4% walk.
